tdl <- read.csv(file = '/Users/Natalie/Documents/R/tdl_subset.csv', header = T)

str(tdl)

#learning how print works

#learning how sprintf() works
aa <- sprintf('letter %s is %s', 1:5, letters[1:5])
print(aa)

require(xts) #package that's good for time data
tdl$datetime <- with(tdl, {
  sprintf('%s %s', date, time)
})
tdl$datetime <- sprintf('%s %s', tdl$date, tdl$time) #this is the same as above - see how with() works
head(tdl) #look at what we did! :-)

timebase <- strptime(tdl$datetime, format = '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
summary(timebase)
str(timebase)
tdlx <- xts(subset(tdl, select = c(-time, -date, -datetime)), timebase)
summary(tdlx)
str(tdlx)
tdlx$chamber.Totalgsw

#graphing the data
require(lattice)
xyplot(as.zoo(tdlx)) #does not work
as.zoo(tdlx)
coredata(tdlx)
plot(tdlx$chamber.Totalgsw)
